tn.text: This was a people group that probably lived near Edom, east of the Jordan River. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is another name for Engedi.

AT: "to try to get God to pay attention to them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: are you not God in heaven? Are you not the ruler over all the kingdoms of the nations?
tn.text: AT: "You are indeed God in heaven and the ruler over all the kings of the earth." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Power and might are in your hand
tn.text: The words "Power" and "might" mean basically the same thing and emphasize the greatness of Yahweh's power. The word "hand" refers to possession. AT: "You possess great power." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: did you not drive out the inhabitants of this land before your people Israel, and give it forever to the descendants of Abraham?
tn.text: AT: "It was you who drove out those who lived in this land for the sake of your people Israel and who gave it permanently to the descendants of Abraham." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: your name is in this house
tn.text: AT: "your presence is here in this house" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
This was a place where the Edomites lived.

tn.ref: See how they are rewarding us; they are coming to drive us out of your land
tn.text: AT: "This is how they 'repay' us for the mercy we showed to them; they are coming to drive us out of your land" See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_irony]]
AT: "please judge them." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
AT: "we are looking to you for help" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: in order to completely kill them and destroy them
tn.text: These two phrases mean basically the same thing. The second intensifies the first. AT: "to completely annihilate them" (UDB). (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
This was a surprise. All their enemies had destroyed each other.

tn.ref: they were dead, fallen to the ground
tn.text: The phrase "fallen to the ground" is an idiomatic way to say that "they were dead." AT: "they were all dead on the ground." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:2ch:05:09|5:9]]

tn.ref: every man of Judah and Jerusalem
tn.text: This is a reference to every fighting man (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]]

tn.ref: The terror of God was on all the kingdoms of the nations
tn.text: "All the kings of the nations greatly feared God"
